message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Quick Assets. Recall that Quick Assets are current assets that are easily convertible to cash, which in this case include:
 • Cash on Hand = 4,540,900.90
 • Bank Deposits = 2,866,063.83
 • Accounts Receivable = 1,851,327.29
 • Interest Receivable = 8,967.44
  Total Quick Assets = 4,540,900.90 + 2,866,063.83 + 1,851,327.29 + 8,967.44 = 9,267,259.46

Step 2: Identify the Total Current Liabilities.
 From the balance sheet: Total Current Liabilities = 1,493,246.99

Step 3: Calculate the Quick Ratio.
 Quick Ratio = Total Quick Assets / Total Current Liabilities
 = 9,267,259.46 / 1,493,246.99 ≈ 6.21

Step 4: Calculate the Net Profit Margin. The formula is:
 Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
 From the income statement:
  Net Profit = 707,199.17
  Total Revenue = 5,064,939.23
 Thus, Net Profit Margin = (707,199.17 / 5,064,939.23) × 100% ≈ 13.96%

Final Answer in the required JSON format:
{
  "solution": {
    "Quick Ratio": "6.21",
    "Net Profit Margin": "13.96%"
  }
}
